questions.q: What is the name of the snowman narrator?
questions.a: Sam (the Snowman)

questions.q: What is Rudolph's father's name?
questions.a: Donner

questions.q: What profession does Hermey the elf want to pursue?
questions.a: Dentist

questions.q: What is the name of the prospector who befriends Rudolph?
questions.a: Yukon Cornelius

questions.q: What does Yukon Cornelius ultimately discover he's been searching for?
questions.a: Peppermint

questions.q: What is the name of the doe who likes Rudolph?
questions.a: Clarice

questions.q: What is the Abominable Snow Monster also called?
questions.a: Bumble

questions.q: Who voices/sings as Sam the Snowman?
questions.a: Burl Ives

questions.q: What does Donner use to hide Rudolph's nose?
questions.a: Soil/dirt and a black cap

questions.q: What is the name of the jack-in-the-box on the Island of Misfit Toys?
questions.a: Charlie

questions.q: What does Mrs. Claus keep insisting Santa do?
questions.a: Eat

questions.q: Who rules the Island of Misfit Toys?
questions.a: King Moonracer

questions.q: What does the Foreman Elf want Hermey to learn to do?
questions.a: Wiggle his ears, chuckle warmly, and go 'hee hee' and 'ho ho'

questions.q: What is Rudolph's coach's name at reindeer school?
questions.a: Comet

questions.q: What name does Fireball suggest the other reindeer call Rudolph?
questions.a: Fire Snout, Rainbow puss, Red schnoz, and Neon Nose are all used

questions.q: What does Bumble's one weakness turn out to be?
questions.a: He sinks in water (doesn't float)

questions.q: What song do the elves sing for Santa?
questions.a: We Are Santa's Elves

questions.q: What does Yukon say the fog is as thick as?
questions.a: Peanut butter

questions.q: How does Hermey neutralize the Bumble?
questions.a: He removes all his teeth

questions.q: What excuse does Yukon give when he falls off the cliff but survives?
questions.a: Bumbles bounce!

questions.q: What is the main theme about being different in Rudolph?
questions.a: That differences can become strengths/assets, and what makes you different can make you special

questions.q: What lesson does Rudolph learn about running away from problems?
questions.a: That you can't run away from your troubles - you have to face them

questions.q: What does the Island of Misfit Toys represent thematically?
questions.a: Those who are rejected by society/don't fit conventional standards but still have value

questions.q: What is Hermey's story arc about?
questions.a: Following your dreams/true calling even when society says you should do something else

questions.q: How does the special address the theme of prejudice?
questions.a: Through how Rudolph is excluded and mocked for being different until his difference becomes useful

questions.q: What does Santa's initial reaction to Rudolph's nose represent?
questions.a: How authority figures/society can reinforce discrimination against those who are different

questions.q: What is the significance of all the 'misfits' finding their place?
questions.a: That everyone has value and can contribute, even if they don't fit traditional expectations

questions.q: What lesson does Donner learn by the end?
questions.a: That he was wrong to be ashamed of his son's difference

questions.q: What does Clarice's song 'There's Always Tomorrow' represent?
questions.a: Hope and believing in someone even when others reject them

questions.q: What is the moral lesson about the misfit toys?
questions.a: That a toy (or person) is never truly happy until they are loved/accepted for who they are

questions.q: What insult do the reindeer call Rudolph that sounds particularly inappropriate today?
questions.a: Rainbow puss

questions.q: What does Donner say is more important than Rudolph's comfort?
questions.a: Self-respect (which really means conformity/hiding who he is)

questions.q: What problematic phrase does Donner use about hiding Rudolph's 'nonconformity'?
questions.a: The film frames hiding his identity as necessary for 'self-respect'

questions.q: What does Clarice's father tell her about associating with Rudolph?
questions.a: That 'no doe of mine is going to be seen with a red-nosed reindeer' (essentially forbidding interracial/inter-group relationships)

questions.q: How does the special reflect 1960s gender roles through Mrs. Donner?
questions.a: She wants to help search for Rudolph but Donner says 'this is man's work'

questions.q: What does Mrs. Claus's entire character revolve around?
questions.a: Making Santa eat/fattening him up (her only role is feeding her husband)

questions.q: What is problematic about how Santa initially treats Rudolph?
questions.a: He basically says Rudolph can't be on the team because of how he looks

questions.q: How does Comet enforce exclusion?
questions.a: He explicitly tells the other reindeer 'we won't let Rudolph join in any reindeer games'

questions.q: What does Donner's reaction to Rudolph's nose parallel in terms of social issues?
questions.a: Parents being ashamed of children who don't conform to social norms/trying to 'fix' or hide them

questions.q: How does the special treat Hermey's career ambitions dismissively?
questions.a: Everyone mocks him for wanting to be a dentist, the Foreman says he'll 'never fit in'

questions.q: What line does Donner say that sounds like he's taking credit for Rudolph's success despite earlier rejection?
questions.a: 'I knew that nose would be useful someday. I knew it all along!'

questions.q: Why is the line 'Even among misfits, you're misfits' darkly funny today?
questions.a: It shows that discrimination and exclusion exist even among marginalized groups

questions.q: What is tokenism as shown at the end of Rudolph?
questions.a: Rudolph is only valued once his 'difference' becomes useful to the majority

questions.q: How does the special inadvertently show ableism?
questions.a: The misfit toys are rejected for minor imperfections like square wheels or a different name

questions.q: What's ironic about Santa promising to help the misfit toys?
questions.a: He only does so AFTER Rudolph proves useful - his change of heart is conditional

questions.q: What toxic masculinity moment does Donner display?
questions.a: Telling his wife she can't come search for Rudolph because 'this is man's work'

questions.q: How is Rudolph's acceptance conditional?
questions.a: He's only accepted after proving his usefulness to society/Santa

questions.q: What does the Foreman Elf's treatment of Hermey reflect about conformity?
questions.a: That not conforming to expected roles is treated as shameful and grounds for exclusion

questions.q: Why is 'you'd better go home with your folks' a cutting line?
questions.a: Comet immediately segregates Rudolph from the other children after his nose is revealed

questions.q: What song lyric do the fawns taunt Rudolph with?
questions.a: 'Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer' - using his own name/identity as an insult

questions.q: What does Hermey do to the dolls that angers his boss?
questions.a: Fixes their teeth

questions.q: What type of animal is King Moonracer?
questions.a: A winged lion

questions.q: What does Fireball call the young female reindeer?
questions.a: Does

questions.q: What name is Rudolph's friend who first greets him at reindeer school?
questions.a: Fireball

questions.q: How does Yukon test where he's searching?
questions.a: He throws his pickaxe, then licks and sniffs it

questions.q: What does Clarice say to Rudolph that makes him fly the first time?
questions.a: 'I think you're cute'

questions.q: What job does Bumble get at the end?
questions.a: Putting stars on top of Christmas trees

questions.q: What is the Foreman Elf's main concern?
questions.a: Making toys and having elves conform to their expected roles

questions.q: How does Sam describe himself?
questions.a: A talking snowman (wearing a waistcoat, bowler hat, and carrying an umbrella)

questions.q: What does Santa say is his reaction to Rudolph's nose at first?
questions.a: 'Great bouncing icebergs!' and expresses concern about him making the sleigh team

questions.q: What supplies does Yukon list that he needs to get?
questions.a: Cornmeal, gunpowder, ham hocks, and guitar strings

questions.q: What does Donner call Rudolph's nose?
questions.a: A 'beak' that 'blinks like a blinking beacon'

questions.q: How long had Rudolph's parents been searching for him according to Santa?
questions.a: Months

questions.q: How many reindeer pull Santa's sleigh traditionally?
questions.a: Eight

questions.q: What does the water pistol misfit toy shoot?
questions.a: Jelly (grape jelly)

questions.q: What bird claims to swim instead of fly?
questions.a: The misfit bird on the Island of Misfit Toys

questions.q: What does the train on the Island of Misfit Toys have wrong with it?
questions.a: Square wheels on its caboose

questions.q: What does the cowboy misfit toy ride?
questions.a: An ostrich

questions.q: What does the spotted elephant ask?
questions.a: 'How would you like to be a spotted elephant?'

questions.q: What is the boat's problem on the Island of Misfit Toys?
questions.a: It can't stay afloat

questions.q: What does the song 'We're a Couple of Misfits' represent?
questions.a: Finding solidarity with others who don't fit in

questions.q: What is the significance of Rudolph leaving his friends on the Island?
questions.a: He thinks he's protecting them, showing self-sacrifice but also isolation

questions.q: Why does King Moonracer save misfit toys?
questions.a: Because he believes they deserve love and a home despite being different

questions.q: What does Hermey and Rudolph's friendship represent?
questions.a: Alliance between different types of outcasts/marginalized individuals

questions.q: What lesson is there in how the community changes toward Rudolph?
questions.a: That acceptance shouldn't be conditional on usefulness, though the special somewhat undercuts this

questions.q: What does Rudolph returning home represent?
questions.a: That you can't escape who you are, and facing your problems is necessary

questions.q: What is symbolic about Rudolph's nose lighting the way?
questions.a: That our differences can illuminate paths for others/guide people through darkness

questions.q: Why is it significant that Hermey becomes a dentist at the end?
questions.a: It shows you can achieve your dreams even when society tells you it's wrong/impossible

questions.q: What does the storm on Christmas Eve represent?
questions.a: A crisis that requires an unconventional solution/different perspective

questions.q: What message is in the misfit toys getting homes?
questions.a: That everyone deserves to be wanted and loved for who they are

questions.q: What's problematic about everyone loving Rudolph only after he guides the sleigh?
questions.a: It suggests acceptance is earned through utility rather than being an inherent right

questions.q: How does the special treat body shaming?
questions.a: Mrs. Claus insists Santa must be fat, saying 'whoever heard of a skinny Santa'

questions.q: What sexist trope does Clarice represent?
questions.a: The supportive female who believes in the male hero when no one else does

questions.q: Why is the Foreman Elf's dismissal of dentistry as a career problematic?
questions.a: It enforces rigid social roles and dismisses individual aspirations

questions.q: What does 'nonconformity' being treated as something to hide say about 1960s values?
questions.a: That conformity was highly valued and differences should be concealed

questions.q: How does peer pressure work in the reindeer games scene?
questions.a: All the fawns immediately turn on Rudolph when his difference is revealed, showing mob mentality

questions.q: What's ironic about Santa criticizing Donner for Rudolph's nose?
questions.a: Santa himself had just expressed the same prejudice moments before

questions.q: Why is Hermey's 'independence' speech both progressive and sad?
questions.a: He has to declare independence because he's rejected for his aspirations

questions.q: What does the special say about physical differences and employment?
questions.a: That Rudolph can only join the 'sleigh team' if his difference is hidden or useful

questions.q: How does the special inadvertently critique capitalism?
questions.a: Toys and individuals are only valued based on their utility/function

questions.q: Complete Santa's song: 'Jingle, jingle, jingle, you will hear my sleigh bells ring...'
questions.a: 'I am old Kris Kringle, I'm the king of jingle-ing'

questions.q: What does Hermey sing about being a misfit?
questions.a: 'Why am I such a misfit? I am not just a nitwit. You can't fire me, I quit! Seems I don't fit in.'

questions.q: What is Sam's opening line about the snowstorm?
questions.a: Talking about a big snowstorm from a couple years ago when 'the world almost missed Christmas'

questions.q: What does Yukon yell when he's excited?
questions.a: 'Wahoo!'

questions.q: What does the doll on the Island of Misfit Toys say?
questions.a: 'How do you do?'

questions.q: What song does Clarice sing to comfort Rudolph?
questions.a: 'There's Always Tomorrow'

questions.q: What classic Christmas song is playing during the ending montage?
questions.a: 'Have a Holly Jolly Christmas'

questions.q: What are the names of all eight original reindeer mentioned?
questions.a: Dasher, Dancer, Prancer, Vixen, Comet, Cupid, Donner, and Blitzen

questions.q: What does Santa ask Rudolph at the climax?
questions.a: 'Rudolph, with your nose so bright, won't you guide my sleigh tonight?'

questions.q: What is Santa's final line in the special?
questions.a: 'Merry Christmas! MERRRRY Christmas!'

questions.q: What does Sam call Christmastown?
questions.a: Better known as the North Pole

questions.q: What does Sam say about Christmas seals?
questions.a: They're seals playing with Christmas presents

questions.q: What month is it when the new fawns meet Santa?
questions.a: April

questions.q: What game are the young reindeer learning?
questions.a: 'Takeoff' - learning to fly

questions.q: What does the elf wear near Rudolph's nose at the end?
questions.a: Sunglasses

questions.q: How do the misfit toys safely get to earth?
questions.a: With umbrellas (an elf drops them with umbrellas)

questions.q: What does Mrs. Claus want to check before Santa leaves?
questions.a: She tells him to turn around so she can check his suit

questions.q: What is the first stop on Santa's route?
questions.a: The Island of Misfit Toys

questions.q: What instrument does Sam play?
questions.a: A banjo

questions.q: What does Yukon initially think he's searching for before changing his mind?
questions.a: Gold (then switches to silver, then finds peppermint)

questions.q: Why does Hermey want to be a dentist?
questions.a: He finds it fascinating and thinks they need one at the North Pole

questions.q: Why does Rudolph leave the Island of Misfit Toys alone?
questions.a: He thinks his glowing nose will endanger his friends

questions.q: Why does Donner feel he needs to hide Rudolph's nose?
questions.a: He's ashamed and thinks Rudolph won't be accepted/make the sleigh team

questions.q: Why does Clarice defy her father?
questions.a: She believes in Rudolph despite his difference

questions.q: What motivates King Moonracer to help misfit toys?
questions.a: Compassion and belief that every toy deserves to be loved by a child

questions.q: Why does Yukon help Rudolph and Hermey?
questions.a: He's friendly and wants them to help him find silver (and companionship)

questions.q: What changes Santa's mind about Rudolph?
questions.a: Realizing his nose can help navigate through the storm

questions.q: Why do Rudolph's parents and Clarice go searching for him?
questions.a: Love and concern for his safety

questions.q: What makes Hermey finally quit his job?
questions.a: The Foreman telling him he'll never fit in and demanding conformity

questions.q: Why does Bumble want a job at the end?
questions.a: He's been reformed and wants to be useful/contribute

questions.q: What time of year was Rudolph born?
questions.a: Springtime

questions.q: How long before the big snowstorm did Rudolph's story begin?
questions.a: A couple of years

questions.q: When is Christmas Eve in the special?
questions.a: The night of the 24th

questions.q: How many days before Christmas Eve does the big storm hit?
questions.a: Two days

questions.q: What appointment time does Hermey set for the Foreman Elf?
questions.a: Week from Tuesday, 4:30 sharp

questions.q: What season is it when the young fawns meet for reindeer games?
questions.a: April (spring)

questions.q: How long for did Donner successfully hide Rudolph's nose?
questions.a: For the first year

questions.q: How long had Rudolph been gone when he returns home?
questions.a: Months (his parents had been searching for months)

questions.q: What is Rudolph's mother's name?
questions.a: Mrs. Donner

questions.q: What is Santa's wife called throughout the special?
questions.a: Mrs. Claus or 'Mama'

questions.q: Who is Dasher's little boy at reindeer practice?
questions.a: The first young fawn who tries takeoff (not named)

questions.q: What is the full name/title of Yukon?
questions.a: Yukon Cornelius, 'the greatest prospector in the North'

questions.q: What specific reindeer is the coach at reindeer school?
questions.a: Comet

questions.q: What is the Abominable Snow Monster's full title?
questions.a: The Abominable Snow Monster of the North

questions.q: What officer position does Charlie hold?
questions.a: Official sentry of the Island of Misfit Toys

questions.q: What type of elf delivers the weather report to Santa?
questions.a: Aviator Elf

questions.q: What is the formal title of the lion on the Island?
questions.a: King Moonracer

questions.q: What role does the Foreman Elf have?
questions.a: He oversees toy production and elf practice/choir

questions.q: What does Sam call the North Pole area?
questions.a: Christmastown

questions.q: What specific forest is shown at the beginning?
questions.a: The Christmas Tree Forest

questions.q: Where do the Clauses live?
questions.a: First castle on the left (the only castle on the left)

questions.q: What is the island with misfit toys called?
questions.a: Island of Misfit Toys (also called Island of Unwanted Toys)

questions.q: What geographic region does Yukon claim as his land?
questions.a: The North/North Pole region

questions.q: What bay does Yukon reference for his silver strike?
questions.a: Hudson Bay ('this side of Hudson Bay')

questions.q: Where does Bumble live?
questions.a: In a cave (the cave of the Abominable Snow Monster)

questions.q: Where do the Donner family live?
questions.a: In a cave

questions.q: What types of teeth does Hermey mention studying?
questions.a: Molars, bicuspids, and incisors

questions.q: What specific toys does the Foreman say they make?
questions.a: Dolls that cry, talk, walk, blink, and run a temperature

questions.q: How many dogs pull Yukon's sled?
questions.a: Five dogs

questions.q: What color is the jack-in-the-box that Charlie pops out of?
questions.a: Purple

questions.q: What color is the spotted elephant?
questions.a: Pink with purple spots (or blue/pink - it's a pink/light colored elephant with spots)

questions.q: What color is the misfit bird?
questions.a: Not specified, but it swims instead of flies

questions.q: What is the nesting toy that opens to reveal smaller toys?
questions.a: Nesting clowns (that end with a wind-up mouse instead)

questions.q: What color is the bear with wings on the Island?
questions.a: Blue

questions.q: What is Sam wearing?
questions.a: A waistcoat, bowler hat, and carrying an umbrella

questions.q: What does the song say decorations are made of?
questions.a: Silver and gold

questions.q: What does Mrs. Donner say when she first sees Rudolph's nose?
questions.a: 'Well, we'll simply have to overlook it'

questions.q: What does Santa say when he first sees Rudolph's glowing nose?
questions.a: 'Great bouncing icebergs!'

questions.q: What phrase does Donner use to describe what Rudolph will be?
questions.a: 'A chip off the old antlers'

questions.q: What does King Moonracer say about living creatures vs toys?
questions.a: 'Unlike playthings, a living creature cannot hide himself on an island'

questions.q: What does the misfit doll say she has no more of?
questions.a: 'I haven't any dreams left to dream'

questions.q: What does Yukon say about the bumble after falling off the cliff?
questions.a: 'Didn't I ever tell you about Bumbles? Bumbles bounce!'

questions.q: What does Charlie say about his name problem?
questions.a: 'No child wants to play with a Charlie-in-the-box'

questions.q: What does Sam say about Rudolph growing up?
questions.a: 'Rudolph was growing up, and growing up made Rudolph realize that you can't run away from your troubles'

questions.q: What does the Foreman Elf say when dismissing Hermey's dentistry aspirations?
questions.a: 'A dentist! Good grief!'

questions.q: What is King Moonracer's philosophy about toys?
questions.a: 'A toy is never truly happy until it is loved by a child'
